org.safs.natives

Class AbstractHook

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.natives.AbstractHook
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    KeyboardHook, LLKeyboardHook, LLMouseHook, MouseHook

    public abstract class AbstractHook
extends java.lang.Object
    AbstractHook is an abstract implementation of setting a callback(hook) procedure for Hook mechanism, by which an application can intercept events in OS, such as messages, mouse actions, and keystrokes.

    Concrete implementation of specific hook types will extend this class.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public boolean addListener(CallbackHookListener listener)
        add a listener for current Hook, it should be overridden in its derived classes for setting a specific listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - -- a CallbackHookListener
        Returns:
        true if succeeds; otherwise false

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(CallbackHookListener listener)
        remove a listener from the listener list
        Parameters:
        listener - -- a CallbackHookListener
        Returns:
        true if succeeds; otherwise false

      • setHook

        protected void setHook(int id,
           StdCallCallback proc)
        set necessary information for a specific hook to be installed
        Parameters:
        id - -- the type of hook
        proc - -- the callback procedure that should matched the first parameter
